short_summary: Upgrading of the aqueduct \\(u201C Sept-Iles, QC
description: The Technical Department, DFO Small Craft Harbour requires construction services for the complete installation of a valve pit on Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) lot at Sept-Iles harbor, commonly known as Bunge Park, including connection to the network and installation of various municipal equipments.
full_summary:
*****************************
### Upgrading of the Aqueduct – Sept-Îles, QC

### Notice URL
None
### Attachment
* [English RFP Document](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/11/10/aed4bdf3aeb87158a02acaac0607899c/30003509_-_rq.pdf)
* [French RFP Document](https://canadabuys.canada.ca/documents/pub/att/2022/11/10/4b4c5b0da31ee8b1ab2cbf8c21a22d72/30003509_-_rq_fr.pdf)

### Overview

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada (DFO) seeks a contractor to provide construction services for the installation of a valve pit at its Sept-Îles harbour facility. The scope of work includes excavation, backfilling, pipe removal and connection, installation of various municipal equipment, electrical, and mechanical-plumbing components.

### Key Requirements

* The contractor must execute the works not earlier than July 15th, 2023 and no later than October 15th, 2023.
* DFO will provide some of the necessary supplies due to order delays for certain items; these items will be specified in the second phase of the tender call.
* The contractor is expected to coordinate with other subcontractors for mechanical-plumbing and electrical works.

### Contract Details

* **Tender Reference Number:** PW-22-01013153
* **Solicitation Number:** 30003509
* **Publication Date:** November 10, 2022
* **Tender Closing Date:** December 2, 2022 (13:00 hours)
* **Contracting Entity:** Fisheries and Oceans Canada
* **Contact Information:**
	+ Karine Plante
	+ Email: DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca
	+ Address: 301 Bishop Drive, Fredericton, NB, E3C 2M6

### Terms and Conditions

The tender is open to all interested and qualified bidders. The bidding process is competitive, and the contract will be awarded based on the proposal that best meets the requirements outlined in the tender document.
